section.section: Any licensee or any person aggrieved may file with the Commissioner a verified complaint that states facts that show sufficient grounds to suspend or revoke a license.
On the filing of a complaint, the Commissioner, after notice and hearing, shall determine whether to suspend or revoke the license.

text.section:
An adviser whose license has been revoked may not obtain another license or renew a license for at least 1 year after:
the date of revocation, if there is no judicial review; or
the final determination in the judicial proceeding confirming the revocation, if there is judicial review.
